Mapper

Class OrderMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • Mapper.OrderMapper

  • public class OrderMapper
extends Object
    This class contains methods that can collect orderlines and orders from a single id or all and return them as an order or a list of orders either from a single id or if your admin then all. OrderMapper is only used and called from GenerateOrder and viewGenerator.
    Author:
    Christian

        public List<Order> getOrdersByUserId(User user)
        Parameters:
        user - is in this method used so that we can extract the id from the user and find the orders regarding this specifik user
        Returns:

      • getAllOrders

        public List<Order> getAllOrders()
        Returns:
        a list of all orders, is used for the admin to get an overview.

      • getOrderById

        public Order getOrderById(int id)
        Parameters:
        id - The id of an order to find the rest of the information of the order id.
        Returns:
        An order where date, id and orderlines has been set.

      • getOrderlinesByOrderId

        public List<Orderline> getOrderlinesByOrderId(Order order)
        Parameters:
        order - Gets the order as a parameter so that the order id can be extracted used to find the orderlines with the respective order id.
        Returns:
        a List of orderlines with the currect order id.

      • getInitOrderById

      • putToOrderdetailsTable

        public void putToOrderdetailsTable(int orderId,
                                   int orderlineId,
                                   int quantity)
                            throws SQLException
        Parameters:
        orderId - expected value and the Id of the Order that the Orderline and quantity are related to.
        orderlineId - expected value and the id of the specific orderline.
        quantity - the quantity of the orderline, if a customer ordered 10 of one type of cupcake.
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • putToOrderTable

        public int putToOrderTable(Order order)
                    throws SQLException
        Insert the order created to the table in the Database
        Parameters:
        order - refers to the order which then can find the user.
        Returns:
        The primary key in the table
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • putToOrderLineTable

        public int putToOrderLineTable(Orderline oLine)
                        throws SQLException
        Parameters:
        oLine - a single orderline is put to the table with an id so that mutiple orderlines can be attached to an order. the orderlines parameters will then be set as well.
        Returns:
        The primary key in the table
        Throws:
        SQLException
